definition[0]: used to ask or talk about the reason for something
example[1]: Why do we have to take all these tests?
example[3]: ‘I won’t be able to come into work tomorrow.’ ‘Why not?’
example[4]: I have no idea why the television isn’t working.
example[5]: Simon loves you – that’s why he wants to be with you.
example[6]: He’s angry with me and I don’t know why.
example[7]: There’s no reason why we shouldn’t be friends.
example[8]: Why on earth didn’t you ask me to help?
example[9]: ‘I don’t want us to be seen together.’ ‘Why ever not?’
definition[1]: used to introduce a question that shows you do not think it is necessary to do something
example[10]: Why worry? You can’t do anything about it.
example[11]: Why waste time going to the bank when you can do it all over the Internet?
definition[2]: used when you are surprised or have suddenly realized something
example[13]: And I thought to myself, why, I can do that.
